comments:
I use CDT as well as phpeclipse. I have a large number of PHP files that use the
.lib file extension. I have this .lib extension associated with the PHP editor.

Once I get this error, I then have to open
org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.core_3.0.0/plugin.xml and remove the "lib"
extension from this:

   <extension point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.contentTypes">
      <file-association
       content-type="org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.core.staticLibrary"
       file-extensions="lib,a"/>
   </extension>

And I can then edit php files that end with the .lib file extension.

I guess my bug is, can this somehow be avoided, other than manually editing the
plugin.xml?

Thanks.

I just installed the latest CDT 3.0 release (I had a nightly build in the
previous bug report) and now it seems that simply editing that one file no
longer suffices to rid me of the problem.

Thoughts?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 116034 ***
